#summary How to get started on this project.

= Introduction =

The Atlanta PM code group has decided to adopt the [http://search.cpan.org/perldoc?Tree::DAG_Node Tree-DAG_Node] CPAN perl module.

= Prerequisite tools =

In order to work on this project, you will need the following software installed:

  * Subversion - [http://subversion.tigris.org/ Home] - [http://subversion.tigris.org/getting.html Download] - [http://svnbook.red-bean.com/ Subversion Book]
        Binary packages available for most platforms, Windows, Linux, OS X, etc.

  * Perl - [http://perl.com/ Home] - [http://www.perl.com/download.csp#binary Download] - [http://www.perl.org/docs.html Documentation]

  * A text editor
        * [http://www.vim.org/download.php Vim] - FOSS - POSIX/Mac OS X/Windows
        * [http://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/ Emacs] - FOSS - POSIX/Mac OS X/Windows
        * [http://macromates.com/ TextMate] - Commercial - Mac OS X
        * [http://www.e-texteditor.com/ E] - Commercial - Windows
        * [http://barebones.com/products/textwrangler/ TextWrangler] - Free - Mac OS X
        * [http://barebones.com/products/bbedit/ BBEdit]- Commercial - Mac OS X 
        * [http://smultron.sourceforge.net/ Smultron] - FOSS - Mac OS X

= Obtain the project source code =

After you have subversion, you can check out the source code.

For command line clients, type the following:
{{{
svn checkout https://atlanta-pm-code.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ atlanta-pm-code --username bobsmith
}}}
        Replace bobsmith with your Google code username (XXXXXX@example.com)
        This command will ask for a your [http://code.google.com/hosting/settings GoogleCode password].  This is not the password you login to gmail with.

For GUI clients, you should be able to do a checkout and provide the subversion URL (https://atlanta-pm-code.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/) and your Google Code username/[http://code.google.com/hosting/settings password].
